name: Air Canada 787-8 Dreamliner [C-GHPV] Beautiful Onboard Takeoff from Vancouver Airport ᴴᴰ
description:
Here it is, the departure of my very first flight onboard the 787 Dreamliner! The aircraft just so happened to be C-GHPV, the first Air Canada 787 I caught with my new camera at YYC in December (link below). This comprehensive, 17 minute video features some exterior shots of the aircraft from the Air Canada Maple Leaf Lounge, the pushback, engine startup, taxi, takeoff, and climb onboard AC003 to Tokyo-Narita International Airport. 

The flight itself was, quite honestly, one of the best I've ever been on. Though I couldn't sleep (which is the case for any avgeek on a new plane), the mood lighting and the cabin pressure allowed me to feel rested and able to function upon landing. The service was excellent as well, along with the brand new entertainment system.

I highly recommend that you view the video with headphones to get the full 787 "experience" while watching. Enjoy the video!

Thanks for watching! Please comment, rate, and subscribe!
____________________________________________________

FLIGHT INFO
Airline: Air Canada (ACA/AC)
Aircraft: Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner (B788)
Aircraft Name: None
Livery: Standard
Engines: 2x GEnx-1B
Seat: 32K
Flying Time: 8 hours and 54 minutes
Departure Time: 1546L
Registration: C-GHPV 
Route: YVR-NRT
Callsign: Air Canada 003 Heavy
Runway used: 26L
FlightAware: http://flightaware.com/live/flight/CGHPV
____________________________________________________

VIDEO LOG (Click on any of the times to skip ahead to that point in the video):
00:13 - Some close up shots of my aircraft, shot from the Air Canada Maple Leaf Lounge (hence why you hear plates clattering)
00:45 - Onboard the aircraft, pushback
01:27 - Being towed forward, passing an Air New Zealand 777-200ER
02:23 - Engine start up sequence commencing
02:47 - Startup smoke from engine #2 visible
03:46 - The aircraft hums to life
04:50 - Flaps begin extending, NavCanada CRJ-200 visible in the background
05:22 - Taxi begins
05:57 - Korean Air Cargo 747-8F seen parked on the de-icing pad
07:44 - Turning onto Taxiway Victor
08:18 - Turning onto Taxiway Hotel
08:55 - Flight controls being checked
09:05 - Another left turn onto Taxiway Delta
09:26 - Zoom in of that beautiful wing
09:45 - Approaching holding point for Runway 26l.
10:04 - A WestJet Encore Q400 lands as the pilots line Fin 804 up on 26L.
11:22 - Takeoff roll begins
11:30 - A bit of spool up can be heard
12:13 - After a 50 second takeoff roll, C-GHPV rotates and lifts off into the Vancouver sky.
13:14 - Flaps retracting
13:34 - From this point on, you can see Bowen, Keats, and Gambier Islands in the background as we follow the Strait of Georgia.
15:13 - Turning right to a heading of 301°
____________________________________________________
